channel.title: Post-Hardcore Bands
channel.description: I've really gotten into post-hardcore bands recently. I listen to a lot of Escape the Fate, Falling in Reverse, Memphis May Fire, Amity Affliction, Pierce the Veil, Of Mice and Men and Crown the Empire. And a few others but, does anyone have any suggestions for me for more of this style of music? I don't like too heavy, but a nice mixture of clean vocals and screams

item.title: Post-Hardcore Bands
item.dc:creator: @D3i7y D3i7y
item.description:
@D3i7y wrote:

i posted some some bands before. i have been listening to a band called

new years day

i’m not sure if they fall under the metalcore catagory but they do sound a bit like some other bands but i love their lyrics to the songs. pretty internesting.

do your worst and angel eyes are my favorite songs. Actualy my girl friend introduced me to them.

I think my all time song would be bring me the horizon - can you feel my heart (both of us love this song you shoulod have a listen.

Read full topic

item.title: Post-Hardcore Bands
item.dc:creator: @D3i7y D3i7y
item.description:
@D3i7y wrote:

We are the ocean & eyes set to kill.

both good bands.for we are the ocean look up

nothing good has happened yet
or
welcome to my broken home

if you want some good eyes set to kill songs

Heights
Broken Frames
Violent Kiss
Give you my all (if you like the softer side of estk :p)

Read full topic

I’ve really gotten into post-hardcore bands recently. I listen to a lot of Escape the Fate, Falling in Reverse, Memphis May Fire, Amity Affliction, Pierce the Veil, Of Mice and Men and Crown the Empire.
